item.title: Extending Video Masked Autoencoders to 128 frames
item.description: Long-video masked autoencoders (LVMAE) achieve state-of-the-art performance by using an adaptive masking strategy that prioritizes important video tokens, enabling efficient training on 128 frames.

item.title: Moving Off-the-Grid: Scene-Grounded Video Representations
item.description: MooG: Self-supervised video model learns off-the-grid representations, enabling consistent scene element tracking even with motion; outperforming grid-based baselines on various vision tasks.

item.title: NeuroClips: Towards High-fidelity and Smooth fMRI-to-Video Reconstruction
item.description: NeuroClips: groundbreaking fMRI-to-video reconstruction, achieving high-fidelity smooth video up to 6s at 8FPS by decoding both high-level semantics and low-level perception flows.

item.title: Splatter a Video: Video Gaussian Representation for Versatile Processing
item.description: Researchers introduce Video Gaussian Representation (VGR) for versatile video processing, embedding videos into explicit 3D Gaussians for intuitive motion and appearance modeling.

item.title: Temporally Consistent Atmospheric Turbulence Mitigation with Neural Representations
item.description: ConVRT: A novel framework restores turbulence-distorted videos by decoupling spatial and temporal information in a neural representation, achieving temporally consistent mitigation.

item.title: TrackIME: Enhanced Video Point Tracking via Instance Motion Estimation
item.description: TrackIME enhances video point tracking by cleverly pruning the search space, resulting in improved accuracy and efficiency.
